business.headline: Exclusive: Adani set to acquire Sahara's crown jewel assets in landmark dealThe deal stems from a long-running dispute ongoing before the Supreme Court led by the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi) against key Sahara entities, requiring them to refund investor money.

Ananya Birla on building Swatantra, making music, and leading with valuesWhether running businesses, writing songs, or leading teams, Ananya Birla believes in giving her all. Speaking at the India Today Conclave Mumbai 2025, she reflected on her early start, her discipline, and the values that guide her.

Ananya Birla on balancing business, music, and leadershipAnanya Birla wears many hats - entrepreneur, musician, and leader. At the India Today Conclave Mumbai 2025, she shared how discipline, values, and passion have helped her navigate each role with purpose.

CBDT extends deadline for filing income tax audit reports to October 31CBDT said the move comes in response to representations from professional bodies, including Chartered Accountant associations, highlighting difficulties in completing audit reports on time.

Sensex tumbles over 500 points, Nifty falls below 25,000The Nifty 50 slipped 0.66% to 24,890.85, while the BSE Sensex eased 0.68% to 81,159.68, logging their longest losing run since early March. Over the past five sessions, the Nifty and Sensex have fallen 2.1% and 2.2%, respectively.

Stock market investing: Can AI really beat human experts?At the India Today Conclave Mumbai 2025, experts discussed how AI is changing stock market investing, whether it can replace traditional methods, and what role human judgement will continue to play.

How not to lose money on the stock market? Experts answer at India Today ConclaveWith increasing participation in equities, especially after the strong returns of the past few years, experts mentioned the importance of patience, asset allocation and realistic expectations.

World's second-richest man pledges to give away 95% of his $373 billion fortuneMuch of his philanthropy is channelled through the Ellison Institute of Technology (EIT), a for-profit organisation based at the University of Oxford. EIT works on global challenges such as healthcare, climate change, food insecurity, and AI research.

Where are Indians heading this festive season? Top destinations revealedCurious where Indians are planning to travel this festive season? From bustling international cities to iconic domestic spots, these are the destinations topping the list.

Festive gold rush: Should you buy jewellery or gold stocks this season?Indians love buying gold, especially in the festive season. However, Dalal Street has also seen an upward trend, with positive domestic developments such as GST rate cuts and income tax reforms earlier in the year.

Court questions Priya Kapur's plea to disclose Sunjay Kapur assets in sealed coverThe application was filed in the ongoing inheritance dispute involving Karisma Kapoor's children, who are claiming a share in their late father's personal assets.
Gold slips from record high. 3 factors explainedGold retreated from its record peak this week, leaving investors curious about what triggered the fall. Here are three key factors behind the dip.

Insurance complaints surge 45% in Q2 as health policies drive cases: ReportRising disputes reveal persistent mis-selling and transparency gaps in India's insurance sector, with policyholders increasingly turning to platforms like Insurance Samadhan to assert rights and seek timely redressal.

Missed the ITR deadline? You will now have to file under new tax regimeWondering what happens if you miss the ITR filing deadline? Did you know you'll automatically be shifted to the new tax regime, losing the option to choose the old one?

Which are the best sectors to invest on Dalal Street right now? Check best picksFrom FMCG to NBFCs, railways, autos and even shipbuilders, analysts see opportunities across a range of sectors as Dalal Street faces volatility.

Sensex, Nifty trade flat after opening lower amid F&O expiry, US visa curbsAt 9:28 am, the S&P BSE Sensex was up 95.55 points at 81,811.18, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 25.65 points to 25,082.55. Broader market indices also traded in the green, though overall sentiment on Dalal Street remained mixed.

Atlanta Electricals IPO allotment out: Check your status, listing date and GMPInvestors who applied for Atlanta Electricals IPO can check their allotment status through either the BSE website or the registrar's platform, MUFG Intime India Private Limited.

Government imposes import curbs on plain silver jewellery till March 2026The restrictions have been introduced in the wake of an import of plain silver jewellery from under preferential duty exemptions rising steeply during April-June 2024-25 to April-June 2025-26.
Should investors be cautious of IT stocks amid H-1B visa changes?With ongoing changes in visa fees and policies, analysts say the outlook for the sector has turned uncertain in the short run.

How NPCI powers half the world's digital payments on just Rs 500 croreNational Payments Corporation of India handles 46% of the world's digital transactions. UPI alone processes 3,729 transactions per second.

Cabinet clears Rs 1,866 crore productivity bonus for railway staffRailway employees are in for festive cheer as the Union Cabinet has approved a productivity-linked bonus, benefiting lakhs of staff members.

Should you have two credit cards? Here's what you need to knowCredit card usage is on the rise in India, and many people are wondering if having a second card makes sense. From rewards to financial flexibility, here's what you should know before applying for another card.

Sensex, Nifty end lower as profit booking continues; Tata Motors falls over 2%The S&P BSE Sensex fell 386.47 points to 81,715.63, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 112.60 points to close at 25,056.90. Broader market indices also ended lower, with sectoral breadth largely negative, except for pharma stocks, which managed modest gains.

Why your cashless insurance claim isn't always 'cashless'Cashless claims promise convenience, but long delays, unclear policies, and unjust deductions often leave patients stressed. Understanding your rights and navigating the system proactively can prevent financial and medical headaches.

PPF, SCSS, SSY: Are Small Saving Scheme interest rates set to change?As the September 30 announcement approaches, savers are wondering if interest rates on popular small saving schemes like PPF, SCSS, and Sukanya Samriddhi Yojana (SSY) will change. Here's what you need to know.

How to buy gold the right way this festive seasonGold shopping is a festive tradition for many Indian families, but with rising prices and endless options, making the right choice can feel tricky. Here's how you can buy gold the right way this season.

H-1B crackdown cracks the rupee. Know why INR hit an all-time lowEconomists estimate that remittances, the money Indians abroad send back, could drop by around $400 million. For a country that relies on foreign money flowing in, that's significant.

Union Cabinet likely to clear bonus for railway staff soon: Government sourcesThe bonus, usually extended to non-gazetted railway employees, is meant to recognise their contribution to the efficiency and performance of one of India's most crucial transport networks.

Income tax audit 2025: Deadlines, rules and penalties you must knowThe clock is ticking for taxpayers who fall under the audit bracket. With the income tax audit deadline for FY 2024–25 just around the corner, here's a quick look at key dates, rules, and penalties.

Confused between Swiggy and Eternal stock? Here's what experts suggestMarket experts say the two companies are in very different positions when it comes to earnings visibility and investor confidence.

Overcharged after GST rate cut? Here's how you can take actionExperts say that raising a complaint not only helps individual consumers reclaim their rightful benefit but also strengthens overall market accountability.

SBI shares gain 1% to hit 52-week high. Should you buy?SBI shares have seen an uptick in the past few days. This has been a reaction to the country's largest lender completing the sale of a part of its stake in YES Bank.

Sensex falls 300 points, Nifty below 25,100 as profit booking continuesAt 9:22 am, the S&P BSE Sensex declined 309 points to 81,792.86, and the NSE Nifty50 slipped 100 points to 25,069.45. Broader market indices also witnessed early losses, led by persistent selling pressure.

Epack Prefab, BMW Ventures, Jain Resource IPOs open today: Where should you bet?Three IPOs will open for bidding today. Epack Prefab Technologies, BMW Ventures, and Jain Resource Recycling begin their public subscriptions today.

What is silver SIP and is it better than gold this festive season?With gold already at peak levels, many investors are asking whether silver, especially through systematic investment plans (SIPs) in exchange traded funds (ETFs), could be a smarter choice this festive season.
GST buying bonanza kicks off, cars lead the wayPM Narendra Modi described GST 2.0 as "a reform dedicated to the people of India," and for many, the benefits were felt immediately.

Is your income tax refund less than Rs 10,000? Here's why it might reach you fasterMany taxpayers are frustrated with refund delays. But here's the catch, simpler refunds tend to move more quickly through the system than bigger claims.

Festive season stock picks: Which sectors are the best bet right now?Autos have already seen a sharp rally, while consumer durables, FMCG, PSU banks, and infrastructure are also emerging as areas to watch.

Sensex and Nifty end flat as IT losses offset consumer stock gainsThe S&P BSE Sensex slipped 11.83 points to 82,102.1, while the NSE Nifty50 settled 32.85 points lower at 25,169.50. The broader small- and mid-cap indices also lagged, declining 0.5% and 0.4%, respectively.

Indian-origin Srinivas Gopalan, Rahul Goyal appointed as CEOs of two big US companiesTwo major US companies have appointed Indian-origin CEOs. Telecom giant T-Mobile announced Srinivasan Gopalan will take over as CEO from November 1. Beverage major Molson Coors has chosen Rahul Goyal as its new CEO, effective October 1. Gopalan's appointment comes as the US wireless market faces challenges, including slowing subscriber growth and fierce competition. Goyal, a company veteran, has previously served in key roles including CFO of Molson Coors India. These appointments are notable amidst discussions around the H1B visa program in the US. A reporter noted, "Desi CEO for US Giants is the biggest news in the day for Telecom and IT space as well." This highlights the significance of these leadership changes in the corporate world.

entertainment.headline: Bhumi Pednekar on trolls: Resilience keeps me going in tough times Actor Bhumi Pednekar at India Today Mumbai Conclave on facing trolls, resilience, box-office lows, and finding courage beyond cinema.

Diljit Dosanjh, Amar Singh Chamkila nominated for International Emmys Diljit Dosanjh has earned an International Emmy nomination for Best Actor for his role in 'Amar Singh Chamkila', which is also competing for Best TV Movie, marking a global recognition of the legendary singer's story.

Video: Ektaa Kapoor talks Kyunki, motherhood and National Award win for Kathal Producer Ektaa Kapoor spoke about 'Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi', motherhood and more during her appearance at India Today Conclave Mumbai 2025. She was present at the session titled 'Queen of Content: Woman Who Shaped Indian Screens'.

Did Ektaa Kapoor take a dig at Ram Kapoor's weight loss? Producer breaks silence Ektaa Kapoor shuts down speculation linking her post to Ram Kapoor, calling it a wild misinterpretation.
"I was talking about body image, not taking a dig," she said while speaking on Day One of India Today Conclave Mumbai 2025.

Varun Dhawan on Sunny Sanskari vs Kantara clash: There's room for all films Varun Dhawan's upcoming film 'Sunny Sanskari Ki Tulsi Kumari' is a lighthearted entertainer designed to uplift moods rather than preach life lessons. The actor graced India Today Conclave 2025 on Thursday and called the film a mood-lifting entertainer.

Ektaa Kapoor on 30 years of content creation: It's not about success but relevance Ektaa Kapoor spoke on Day 1 of the India Today Conclave Mumbai 2025. She shared insights on her three-decade-long journey, highlighting the importance of relevance over mere success.

Ektaa Kapoor never imagined Kathal would win best film at National Awards Producer Ektaa Kapoor shared her excitement about winning the National Award for her film 'Kathal' at the India Today Mumbai Conclave. She expressed that not in her wildest dreams did she think a dramedy would clinch the award.

We're children of cinema: Kamal Haasan to youngest National Award winner Treesha Kamal Haasan congratulated young Treesha Thosar, who became the youngest recipient to win a National Award at the age of four. The veteran actor won a National Award when he was six years old.

We are tackling various judgements women are put through: Ektaa Kapoor on Kyunki... Ektaa Kapoor spoke about her experience in the film and television industry at India Today Conclave Mumbai 2025. She appeared at the session titled 'Queen of Content: Woman Who Shaped Indian Screens'.

Nagarjuna gets Delhi High Court protection from AI misuse, fake content Nagarjuna Akkineni has secured a significant victory from the Delhi High Court to protect his personality and publicity rights against unauthorised use of his name, image and voice, especially in AI-generated content. This landmark ruling highlights the growing concern over misuse of celebrity identities in India's digital age.

OTT this week: Fantastic Four, Son of Sardaar 2, Slow Horses and more to stream This week's OTT line-up offers a mix of thrillers, dramas, and superhero sagas, from Marvel's 'Fantastic Four' and 'Marvel Zombies' to the much-awaited 'Slow Horses Season 5' and 'Alice in Borderland 3'. With regional gems like 'Sundarakanda' and gritty dramas like 'Janaawar', there's something for every kind of viewer.

What is the scene in The Ba***ds of Bollywood that offended Sameer Wankhede? Former Narcotics Control Bureau official Sameer Wankhede has filed Rs 2 crore defamation suit against the producers of Aryan Khan's Netflix series The B***ds of Bollywood. He has alleged that a character on the show is a parody of him.

Emma Watson says Hollywood broke her, explains break from acting Hollywood actor Emma Watson shared her reasons for taking a step back from acting in a recent podcast. She opened up about the lack of connection after 'Harry Potter' and how competition, envy and hierarchy affected her experiences on set.

Fans slash screen at Pawan Kalyan's OG screening in Bengaluru, premiere halts 'They Call Him OG' drew massive fan excitement after its release on September 25. However, the celebrations turned chaotic in Bengaluru when some fans vandalised the cinema screen, causing a temporary halt to the screening.

Naseeruddin Shah, Jim Sarbh bring Titan's story to OTT with Made in India Actors Naseeruddin Shah and Jim Sarbh are set to star in a series on how the brand Titan came about and the men who played a key role in building it. Here's when you will be able to watch 'Made In India-A Titan Story' on OTT.

Meet Treesha Thosar, 4-year-old youngest National Award winner for Naal 2 At just four, Treesha Vivek Thosar made history at the 71st National Awards, becoming the youngest ever to win Best Child Artist for 'Naal 2'.

Search trailer: Konkona Sensharma hunts for truth in Rohan Sippy's crime thriller The trailer of 'Search: The Naina Murder Case' promises a gripping crime thriller where every suspect hides secrets and social media plays a crucial role in uncovering the truth. Konkona Sensharma leads as ACP Sanyukta Das in this multilayered investigation premiering on JioHotstar.

Salman and Aamir on why older men romance younger women but not vice versa Salman Khan and Aamir Khan were questioned by Kajol and Twinkle Khanna about frequently romancing younger heroines in films. The conversation highlighted gender norms and ageism in Bollywood, sparking debate on industry practices.

Who is Bhanu Khan? Original Duniya Haseeno Ka star replaced by Mona Singh in B***ds Aryan Khan's The 'Ba**ds of Bollywood' recreates the iconic 1997 song 'Duniya Haseeno Ka Mela', bringing back Bhanu Khan's memorable dance performance through clever VFX.

general news.headline: Musician present during Zubeen Garg's yacht trip arrested by probe teamMusician Shekhar Jyoti Goswami has been taken into custody for questioning, though officials have not yet disclosed the nature of allegations against him or whether formal charges will follow.

Ex-CJI Chandrachud responds to charge of giving bail cases to Justice Bela TrivediRejecting the charge that bail matters were concentrated with one judge during his tenure as Chief Justice, DY Chandrachud said that cases involving bail are dealt with by every single bench of the Supreme Court.

Sloppy Pakistan survive sloppier Bangladesh to book final date vs IndiaAsia Cup 2025: Pakistan were far from their best with the bat in the virtual semi-final against Bangladesh, but their bowling came to the rescue. For the first time in Asia Cup history, India and Pakistan will meet in the final on Sunday, 28 September.

Azim Premji refuses to lend Wipro road to Siddaramaiah to ease Bengaluru trafficWipro founder Azim Premji cited legal, governance, and SEZ-related constraints in refusing Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah's request, but expressed willingness to collaborate on data-driven solutions to Bengaluru traffic issues.

No shame, just science: Ektaa Kapoor talks weight, inflammation and OzempicAt the India Today Conclave in Mumbai, media maven Ektaa Kapoor, in a refreshingly honest exchange, dismantled myths, embraced vulnerability, and opened up about the realities of weight loss in an industry that often equates size with success.

Foreign fund licence of Sonam Wangchuk's NGO scrapped day after Ladakh violenceThe Centre has cancelled the foreign funding license licence of Sonam Wangchuk's NGO after the Leh violence, citing violations including irregular deposits, local funds in FCRA account, and foreign funding for sovereignty studies.

Diljit Dosanjh, Amar Singh Chamkila nominated for International EmmysDiljit Dosanjh has earned an International Emmy nomination for Best Actor for his role in 'Amar Singh Chamkila', which is also competing for Best TV Movie, marking a global recognition of the legendary singer's story.

Sameer Wankhede vs Shah Rukh, sues Ba***ds of Bollywood makers for defamationThe suit seeks relief in the form of a permanent and mandatory injunction, a declaration, and damages over what Sameer Wankhede alleges is a "false, malicious, and defamatory" portrayal in the Netflix series "Ba***ds of Bollywood.

Does age really have the final word on pregnancy?Katrina joins a growing list of Indian celebrities who are embracing motherhood later in life, challenging old timelines and societal norms. Doctors say with the right health profile, women in their 40s can and do have healthy pregnancies.

Deva Bhau reveals how a Brahmin came to lead Maratha-dominated MaharashtraMaharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis, who belongs to the Brahmin community, revealed how he overcame caste-based political hurdles to lead the Maratha-dominated state where his community makes up just 2% of the population.

Why Azam Khan's release from jail could mark a new churn in UP politicsThe Samajwadi Party veteran is speculated to be unhappy with chief Akhilesh Yadav and contemplating a shift to the BSP or Dalit leader Chandrashekhar Azad's party

Foreign-backed sinister plan? Why Sonam Wangchuk is in the eye of Ladakh stormActivist Sonam Wangchuk, who was leading a hunger strike for Ladakh's statehood, now finds himself accused of sparking deadly violence in Leh. From Arab Spring references to a CBI probe on foreign funding, the celebrated innovator is now the Centre's prime target for the chaos in Leh.

Salman and Aamir on why older men romance younger women but not vice versaSalman Khan and Aamir Khan were questioned by Kajol and Twinkle Khanna about frequently romancing younger heroines in films. The conversation highlighted gender norms and ageism in Bollywood, sparking debate on industry practices.

'Erection of Babri Masjid act of desecration' remark misinterpreted: DY ChandrachudDY Chandrachud clarified that his remark on the Babri Masjid had been taken out of context, claiming that selective excerpts shared on social media had led to a misrepresentation of his views on the Ayodhya dispute.

All 'no's I heard growing up shaped me: Bhumi Pednekar on challenges in cinemaActor Bhumi Pednekar spoke about bringing noticeable change and impact through her film as a part of her session titled 'Power of Presence in Changing Industry' on Day 1 of India Today Conclave Mumbai 2025.

Grandmother, 73, deported to India after 30 years in US, didn't get to say goodbyeA 73-year-old Sikh woman who lived in the US for over 30 years was deported to India by the US Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE). Harjit Kaur, originally from Punjab, was not even allowed to say goodbye to her family before being deported to India. She was handcuffed as she was taken to the ICE centre in Los Angeles.

They Call Him OG review: Pawan Kalyan lifts predictable film with unmatched auraRelease Date:Thu Sep 25, 2025They Call Him OG movie review: Director Sujeeth's 'They Call Him OG' is a fan-service to Power Star Pawan Kalyan. The gangster drama, with a Japanese connection, has redundant ideas but is lifted by rousing elevation sequences.

Advantage NDA in Bihar, women votes may trump Muslim-Yadav factor: Top pollstersThe 243-member Bihar Legislative Assembly is slated to go to polls in late October or early November with the NDA and the Mahagathbandhan being the top contenders.

Nair bloc hailing Ayappa conclave, can Pinarayi give Kerala's Hindu vote a Left turnThe Opposition's apprehensions of a vote shift may not be entirely imaginary as both the Nair Service Society and an Ezhava-dominated outfit have praised the Pinarayi Vijayan government

What Ex-CJI Chandrachud said on nepo-kid allegationsFormer Chief Justice of India (CJI) DY Chandrachud said there needs to be standard system to recruit judges. On the charges of being a product of nepotism, he said that people need to be judged by the quality of their work. Chandrachud's father was also a CJI.

Rare alignment shows two comets racing in Earth's skiesDespite their vastly different origins and paths through space, from Earth they appeared side-by-side, creating a rare visual race across the skies.

Thin-fat Indians prove obesity isn't about size alone, says Dr Shashank JoshiDuring a session at India Today Conclave, senior endocrinologist Dr. Shashank Joshi explained that Indians usually appear slim but carry excess fat, a condition described as being "thin-fat." He said this unique body type puts Indians at higher risk of obesity-related diseases even at a normal BMI.

No words: Karun Nair reacts to India vs West Indies Test selection snubIND vs WI: Karun Nair expressed his disappointment after being omitted from India's Test squad for the West Indies tour. The Karnataka batter, who returned to the Test squad after eight years during the England series, struggled for consistency in the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy.

Zubeen Garg death: SIT conducts raids, Himanta says will seek CBI probe if neededAssam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma said the truth behind Zubeen Garg's death in Singapore should be clear within 15 days as the SIT concludes its probe. He said a CBI investigation would be sought if the SIT probe was found unsatisfactory. The SIT raided the homes of Zubeen's manager Siddhartha Sharma and Shyamkanu Mahanta, the chief organiser of the event for which the singer travelled to Singapore.

sports.headline: 41 years, 17 Asia Cups later, it's an India vs Pakistan final India and Pakistan will meet in the Asia Cup 2025 final for the first time ever. Pakistan qualified for the final with an 11-run victory over Bangladesh in their last Super 4 clash.

Sloppy Pakistan survive sloppier Bangladesh to book final date vs India Asia Cup 2025: Pakistan were far from their best with the bat in the virtual semi-final against Bangladesh, but their bowling came to the rescue. For the first time in Asia Cup history, India and Pakistan will meet in the final on Sunday, 28 September.

World Para Athletics Champs underway in Delhi with PM Modi's motivational message India proudly hosts the World Para Athletics Championships 2025 with over 2,200 athletes from 100 countries. They become the fourth Asian nation to host the World Para Athletics Championships, following Qatar (2015), the UAE (2019), and Japan (2024).

Archery: Sheetal targets gold at Para Worlds; historic all-Indian men's final India has guaranteed at least three medals at the Para Archery World Championships 2025 with an all-India men's final and Sheetal Devi reaching the women's final in the compound category. 18-year-old Sheetal, who shoots with her legs, is bidding to win her maiden gold at the world meet.

Bumrah playing vs WI a missed opportunity to groom young fast bowler: Pathan Irfan Pathan believes playing Jasprit Bumrah in both Tests against West Indies is a missed opportunity to develop young pacers. India and West Indies will play in a two-match Test series from October 2- October 14.

No words: Karun Nair reacts to India vs West Indies Test selection snub IND vs WI: Karun Nair expressed his disappointment after being omitted from India's Test squad for the West Indies tour. The Karnataka batter, who returned to the Test squad after eight years during the England series, struggled for consistency in the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy.

Kumar Sangakkara set to replace Rahul Dravid as head coach at Rajasthan Royals IPL 206: Kumar Sangakkara is set to Rajasthan Royals as head coach following Rahul Dravid's departure. The former Sri Lankan captain has been associated with the franchise as its Director of Cricket.

Duckayub: Pakistan youngster cops fans' wrath after 4th duck in 6 games Young Pakistan batter Saim Ayub fell for his fourth duck in the Asia Cup on Thursday. Batting against Pakistan Ayub once again failed at the top of the batting order.

Suryakumar completes ICC hearing over Pakistan's complaint, decision on Friday The PCB lodged a complaint against Suryakumar Yadav for dedicating India's 14 September win to the Armed Forces and the victims of the Pahalgam attack. It came in response to the BCCI's complaint to the ICC over Haris Rauf and Sahibzada Farhan's provocative gestures on 21 September.

Litton Das fails to recover for Pakistan clash, stars return for Bangladesh Asia Cup, PAK vs BAN: Bangladesh will be without skipper Litton Das due to a rib injury, with Jaker Ali continuing as stand-in, and have made three changes to their XI after losing to India.

Kumar Sangakkara set to replace Rahul Dravid as head coach at Rajasthan Royals IPL 206: Kumar Sangakkara is set to Rajasthan Royals as head coach following Rahul Dravid's departure. The former Sri Lankan captain has been associated with the franchise as its Director of Cricket.

Duckayub: Pakistan youngster cops fans' wrath after 4th duck in 6 games Young Pakistan batter Saim Ayub fell for his fourth duck in the Asia Cup on Thursday. Batting against Pakistan Ayub once again failed at the top of the batting order.

Suryakumar completes ICC hearing over Pakistan's complaint, decision on Friday The PCB lodged a complaint against Suryakumar Yadav for dedicating India's 14 September win to the Armed Forces and the victims of the Pahalgam attack. It came in response to the BCCI's complaint to the ICC over Haris Rauf and Sahibzada Farhan's provocative gestures on 21 September.

Litton Das fails to recover for Pakistan clash, stars return for Bangladesh Asia Cup, PAK vs BAN: Bangladesh will be without skipper Litton Das due to a rib injury, with Jaker Ali continuing as stand-in, and have made three changes to their XI after losing to India.

Jasprit Bumrah avoiding death overs? Pacer rejects Mohammad Kaif's takeIndia pacer Jasprit Bumrah called out Mohammad Kaif on X for inaccurate assessment of his fitness. Kaif had speculated that Bumrah is avoiding bowling in the death overs due to chances of injury.

IND A vs AUS A: Rahul, Sudharsan keep India in hunt for massive 412-run targetKL Rahul and Sai Sudharsan have kept India A in contention of chasing a massive target against Australia A. Rahul battled fever to score a sublime 74.

India A Women stun New Zealand after Shafali Verma heroics in warmupWomen's World Cup: India A Women edged out New Zealand Women in a thrilling warm-up match at Bengaluru, chasing 224 under the DLS method and winning by four wickets with three balls to spare.

Highlights: Pakistan set up final vs India with glorious win vs BangladeshPakistan (PAK) vs Bangladesh (BAN) Highlights, Asia Cup Super 4: Pakistan have set up Asia Cup final vs India with a riveting bowling performance against Bangladesh. Haris Rauf and Shaheen Shah Afridi have led their struggling team to the final of the continental tournament. Chasing 136, Bangladesh only managed 124/9 in their 20 overs.

R Praggnanandhaa plays jenga at home, hilarious video goes viralIndia's top ranked chess player R Praggnanandhaa posted a hilarious video of him playing jenga at home. Amidst a hectic schedule, the chess star found his happy place in a friendly board game.

Arundhati Reddy suffers freak accident in injury scare for IndiaWomen's World Cup: India suffered a major injury scare as pacer Arundhati Reddy was stretchered off after a freak on-field accident during the warm-up game against England in Bengaluru.

Khalid Jamil urges AIFF-ISL clubs to solve players release issues: Need to work togetherIndian head coach Khalid Jamil urges the All India Football Federation and ISL clubs to address delayed player releases, which have disrupted national team preparations for crucial Asian Cup qualifiers, highlighting the ongoing club-country conflict.

Performance dictates selection: Agarkar clears air on big calls in WI series squadIndia chief selector Ajit Agarkar announced the Test squad for their upcoming Test series against West Indies, and fans have raised concerns over some key omissions from the side. However, Agarkar reasoned that every selection for the Indian team is strictly performance-driven.

R Praggnanandhaa plays jenga at home, hilarious video goes viralIndia's top ranked chess player R Praggnanandhaa posted a hilarious video of him playing jenga at home. Amidst a hectic schedule, the chess star found his happy place in a friendly board game.

Arundhati Reddy suffers freak accident in injury scare for IndiaWomen's World Cup: India suffered a major injury scare as pacer Arundhati Reddy was stretchered off after a freak on-field accident during the warm-up game against England in Bengaluru.

Khalid Jamil urges AIFF-ISL clubs to solve players release issues: Need to work togetherIndian head coach Khalid Jamil urges the All India Football Federation and ISL clubs to address delayed player releases, which have disrupted national team preparations for crucial Asian Cup qualifiers, highlighting the ongoing club-country conflict.

Performance dictates selection: Agarkar clears air on big calls in WI series squadIndia chief selector Ajit Agarkar announced the Test squad for their upcoming Test series against West Indies, and fans have raised concerns over some key omissions from the side. However, Agarkar reasoned that every selection for the Indian team is strictly performance-driven.

Justice for Abhimanyu Easwaran: Fans criticise WI series snub, Agarkar explains callFans have labelled Abhimanyu Easwaran's omission from the India squad for West indies Tests as pure "injustice" to the batter. Ajit Agarkar explained the call, citing no need for an extra opener.

Varun Chakravarthy blames Ring of Fire in Dubai for India's drop catchesAsia Cup 2025, IND vs BAN: Varun Chakravarthy said that the Ring of Fire in Dubai has made it tough for the Indian fielders to take catches in the ongoing tournament. On Wednesday, India beat Bangladesh by 41 runs to qualify for the final.

Clarity on role, David Warner mindset: R Ashwin on Thunder moveR Ashwin explained why he decided to make the move to join Sydney Thunder as he created history with his move to join the Big Bash League franchise. Ashwin became the first player to represent India to play in the franchise.

IND vs WI: 10 key takeaways from Ajit Agarkar's Test squad announcementAjit Agarkar confirmed during the squad announcement Rishabh Pant will return as India's vice-captain once fit. Jasprit Bumrah is available for both Tests against West Indies, while Mohammed Shami misses out due to limited recent match practice.

Shami snub, India's fast-bowling roadmap: Agarkar explains big squad callsAjit Agarkar explained why Mohammed Shami was snubbed from the squad for the upcoming series against the West Indies. Agarkar also revealed India's pace bowling roadmap going forward.

Mumbai Indians name two-time world champion as head coach for WPLMumbai Indians have named Lisa Keightley as their new head coach for the Women's Premier League. Her appointment aims to build on MI's success and maintain their dominance in the tournament.

No workload management: Jasprit Bumrah available for both West Indies TestsIND vs WI: India's chief selector Ajit Agarkar confirmed that Jasprit Bumrah is fully fit and available for both Tests against the West Indies, having had sufficient rest after missing the fifth England Test.

Shreyas Iyer's India A captaincy not a confirmation of ODI leadership: Ajit AgarkarShreyas Iyer's appointment as the India A captain for the unofficial one-day series vs Australia A fuelled talks of him being in line for ODI leadership. Ajit Agarkar, however, dismissed captaincy speculation, clarifying Iyer's India A role doesn't guarantee him the ODI leadership mantle.

End of the road for Karun Nair in Tests? Agarkar explains West Indies squad snubKarun Nair's exclusion from the India squad for the West Indies series was explained by Chief selector Ajit Agarkar. Karun failed to make his mark during the England tour, where he played four out of five Tests.

After stellar England Tests, Ravindra Jadeja made vice-captain for West Indies seriesIND vs WI: After a stupendous Test series against England where he scored over 500 runs, Ravindra Jadeja has been made the vice-captain for the Test series against the West Indies in the absence of Rishabh Pant.

IND vs WI: No place for Karun Nair as India announce squad for Test seriesThere was no spot for Karun Nair as India announced their squad for the upcoming Test series against the West Indies. Devdutt Padikkal and Axar Patel make their returns to the squad for the two-match series.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
